meanings.definition: Of, relating to, forming, or of the nature of a skeleton.
meanings.sent1: The doctor studied the skeletal remains to learn about the ancient human.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a skeletal model of a dinosaur for visitors to see.
meanings.sent3: The Halloween costume was so realistic, it looked like a skeletal ghost!
meanings.sent4: The old building stood skeletal against the darkening sky, like a haunting memory.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting captured the skeletal beauty of the bare tree in winter.

meanings.definition: Resembling a skeleton in form or structure.
meanings.sent1: The tree branches in winter appeared skeletal against the gray sky.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned house had a skeletal frame, with only a few walls standing.
meanings.sent3: The cake was so poorly baked; it looked skeletal, not appetizing at all!
meanings.sent4: The city skyline at dusk looked skeletal, with silhouettes of buildings against the fading light.
meanings.sent5: The mountain range in the distance seemed skeletal, like giant bones reaching into the sky.
